definition: cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: The unions are also using their muscle to install placemen as Labour parliamentary candidates.
sentences.chinese: 作为工党议会侯选人，工会也正在布署方案。

sentences.english: They saturated the area with police to prevent any trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他们在那个地区布署了警察以防任何麻烦。

sentences.english: Accordingly two alternative schemes of oil exploration have been proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了两个可供选择的油气勘探布署方案。

sentences.english: This chapter describes deployment representations for security requirements.
sentences.chinese: 本章描述安全需求的典型布署。

sentences.english: Detectives were set at all the exits.
sentences.chinese: 这些出口都布署了警探。

sentences.english: They disposed troops along the river.
The chief posted 2 police officers at the eyewitness' home.
sentences.chinese: 院长在目击者的家中布署了2名警官。

sentences.english: This is accomplished declaratively by use of the deployment descriptors mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 这是通过使用布署描述符机制公布完成的。

definition: to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
